text:
Crime and Punishment

Raskolnikov walked on the street, feeling alone and quiet, like the stones beneath his feet. Suddenly, he noticed a crowd about two hundred yards away. He could hear voices and shouts. In the crowd, there was a carriage, and a light shone in the middle of the street. 

"What is happening?" Raskolnikov thought as he moved closer to the crowd. He felt a strange mix of emotions and smiled coldly when he realized what was going on. He had already decided to go to the police station, and he knew it would all be over soon.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov approaches a crowd in the dusk, feeling resolved to go to the police station as he recognizes the situation unfolding.
